str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
A calling, invitation; in the NT, always of a divine call. From a shorter form of kaleo; an invitation.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
From protithemai; a setting forth, i.e. proposal; specially, the show-bread as exposed before God.
And, even, also, namely.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
A primary preposition; 'fore', i.e. In front of, prior to.
A space of time or interval; by extension, an individual opportunity; by implication, delay.
From aion; perpetual.
